condition.description:
Flu is a respiratory infection caused by a number of viruses. The viruses pass through the air and enter your body through your nose or mouth. Between 5% and 20% of people in the U.S. get the flu each year. The flu can be serious or even deadly for elderly people, newborn babies, and people with certain chronic illnesses.

Symptoms of the flu come on suddenly and are worse than those of the common cold. They may include

  • Body or muscle aches
  • Chills
  • Cough
  • Fever
  • Headache
  • Sore throat

Is it a cold or the flu? Colds rarely cause a fever or headaches. Flu almost never causes an upset stomach. And "stomach flu" isn't really flu at all, but gastroenteritis.

Most people with the flu recover on their own without medical care. People with mild cases of the flu should stay home and avoid contact with others, except to get medical care. If you get the flu, your health care provider may prescribe medicine to help your body fight the infection and lessen symptoms.

The main way to keep from getting the flu is to get a yearly flu vaccine. Good hygiene, including hand washing, can also help.

NIH: National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases
condition.name: Flu

carousel_items: Alka-Seltzer Plus Cold and Cough starts working in about 30 minutes.
Chlorpheniramine (the antihistamine in Alka-Seltzer Plus Cold and Cough) can make you sleepy, so avoid activities that require you to be fully alert until you know how it affects you.
Phenylephrine (the decongestant ingredient) can make you restless, so don't take it too close to bedtime.
Let your doctor know if your symptoms don't improve in a few days, or if you have a really bad sore throat with a fever, headache, nausea, or vomiting.
Don't take Alka-Seltzer Plus Cold and Cough if you're pregnant.

basics.benefits_moa: Alka-Seltzer Plus Cold and Cough is a combination medicine that treats cold and flu symptoms. Aspirin relieves pain and reduces fever. Chlorpheniramine is an antihistamine that treats runny nose and watery eyes. Dextromethorphan is a cough suppressant. Phenylephrine is a decongestant that clears your sinuses.
basics.bottom_line: Alka-Seltzer Plus Cold and Cough is good for multiple cold symptoms, but it's more medicine than you need if you only have one symptom.
downsides: If you don't really need all of the medications in this combination, you're taking extra medicine and might have extra side effects for no reason.
Phenylephrine doesn't last as long as other decongestants like pseudoephedrine.
You shouldn't use it if you have high blood pressure.
The aspirin in Alka-Seltzer Plus Cold and Cough interacts with many other drugs and health conditions.

downsides_processed.orig: If you don't really need all of the medications in this combination, you're taking extra medicine and might have extra side effects for no reason.
Phenylephrine doesn't last as long as other decongestants like pseudoephedrine.
You shouldn't use it if you have high blood pressure.
The aspirin in Alka-Seltzer Plus Cold and Cough interacts with many other drugs and health conditions.

upsides: Alka-Seltzer Plus Cold and Cough is a combination medicine that relieves multiple cold symptoms. It's good to use if you have a stuffy nose, a cough, fever, and pain.

Phenylephrine (the decongestant ingredient) has fewer side effects than other decongestants like pseudoephedrine. It doesn't raise your blood pressure and heart rate as much, or cause as much trouble falling asleep.
Dextromethorphan (the cough suppressant ingredient) works well and has very few side effects.

risks_warnings.title: Stomach bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Alka-Seltzer Plus Cold and Cough contains aspirin, which can cause serious problems including inflammation, bleeding, and ulcers in the stomach or intestines. The longer you take Alka-Seltzer Plus Cold and Cough, the higher the risk is. If you notice blood or a dark/black color in your stool, tell your doctor right away.
risk_factors: History of stomach bleeding or ulcers
Taking aspirin, NSAIDs, or blood thinners
Drinking more than 3 alcoholic beverages a day

description_processed.orig: Alka-Seltzer Plus Cold and Cough contains aspirin, which can cause serious problems including inflammation, bleeding, and ulcers in the stomach or intestines. The longer you take Alka-Seltzer Plus Cold and Cough, the higher the risk is. If you notice blood or a dark/black color in your stool, tell your doctor right away.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Chlorpheniramine, the antihistamine in Alka-Seltzer Plus Cold and Cough, lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful and avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery until you know how this medication affects you.
risk_factors: Taking with other medicines that make you less alert

description_processed.orig: Chlorpheniramine, the antihistamine in Alka-Seltzer Plus Cold and Cough, lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful and avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery until you know how this medication affects you.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to unborn babies
risks_warnings.description: Alka-Seltzer Plus Cold and Cough can harm unborn babies. Aspirin can increase the risk of a heart defect in an unborn baby if you take it during the last 3 months of pregnancy (last trimester). Phenylephrine can also be unsafe to take during the first 3 months of pregnancy (first trimester). Instead, it's safer to use a decongestant nasal spray for up to 3 days. Talk with your doctor or pharmacist about what's safe and will work best for you while pregnant.

risks_warnings.title: Reye's syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Alka-Seltzer Plus Cold and Cough contains aspirin, which has been linked to a rare but serious illness called Reye syndrome. Alka-Seltzer Plus Cold and Cough shouldn’t be used in children and teenagers. If you notice changes in your child’s behavior or nausea and vomiting (early signs of Reye’s syndrome), call your doctor and get medical care right away.

risks_warnings.title: High blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: People taking Alka-Seltzer Plus Cold and Cough and MAO inhibitors together, or up to 14 days apart from each other, can experience very high blood pressure that can cause headaches and strokes. MAOI drugs are used to treat Parkinson's disease, depression, and other emotional conditions. Talk to your doctor or pharmacist if you're taking MAO inhibitors and still want to use a cough medicine.

description_processed.orig: People taking Alka-Seltzer Plus Cold and Cough and MAO inhibitors together, or up to 14 days apart from each other, can experience very high blood pressure that can cause headaches and strokes. MAOI drugs are used to treat Parkinson's disease, depression, and other emotional conditions. Talk to your doctor or pharmacist if you're taking MAO inhibitors and still want to use a cough medicine.

risks_warnings.title: Serotonin syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Serotonin syndrome is a rare but potentially life-threatening condition when there's too much serotonin in the brain. The dextromethorphan in Alka-Seltzer Plus Cold and Cough, when used with other medicines that affect serotonin (antidepressants, lithium, triptans, St. John's wort), increases your risk for serotonin syndrome. Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Get medical attention right away if you have these symptoms.
risk_factors: Using other medications that affect serotonin

userStories.tip: No dextromethorphan, which makes my pupils dilate and causes other bad things. Doesn't make me sleepy either. Mix with water and drink all at once or over time (I put one dose in a 12oz bottle of water and drink over 4 hours).

basics.benefits_moa: Alka-Seltzer Plus Day Cold and Flu is a combination medicine that treats cold and flu symptoms. Acetaminophen relieves pain and reduces fever. Dextromethorphan is a cough suppressant. Phenylephrine is a decongestant that clears your sinuses.
basics.bottom_line: Alka-Seltzer Plus Day Cold and Flu is good for multiple cold symptoms, but it's more medicine than you need if you only have one symptom.
downsides: If you don't really need all of the medications in this combination, you're taking extra medicine and might have extra side effects for no reason.
Phenylephrine doesn't last as long as other decongestants like pseudoephedrine.
You shouldn't use it if you have high blood pressure.
To avoid hurting your liver, you need to keep track of the total amount of acetaminophen (APAP) you are taking since it is a very common ingredient in pain and cold/flu combination medicines.

risks_warnings.title: Liver damage
risks_warnings.description: Alka-Seltzer Plus Day Cold and Flu contains acetaminophen, also known as Tylenol or APAP, and is a common ingredient in many other over-the-counter medicines. Taking too much acetaminophen causes liver damage that can be permanent and life-threatening. In case of an overdose, call your local Poison Control Center and get medical attention immediately.
risk_factors: Drinking more than 2 alcoholic beverages a day

risks_warnings.title: Chronic cough from an infection
risks_warnings.description: Let your doctor know if you have lung problems like chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) or a chronic cough before taking Alka-Seltzer Plus Day Cold and Flu. Make sure to tell your doctor if your cough doesn't go away after a week or comes back after getting better, especially if you're coughing up significantly more mucus (phlegm), which can be a sign of a more serious infection.

The dextromethorphan in Alka-Seltzer Plus Day Severe Cold and Flu, when used with other medicines that affect serotonin (antidepressants, lithium, triptans, St. John's wort), increases your risk for serotonin syndrome. Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Get medical attention right away if you have these symptoms.
risk_factors: Using other medications that affect serotonin

carousel_items: Alka-Seltzer Plus Night Cold and Flu starts working in about 30 minutes.
Doxylamine (the antihistamine ingredient) can make you tired, so take it close to bedtime.

Contains acetaminophen, also known as Tylenol or APAP. Taking too much can cause liver failure and death. Don't take more than what's recommended on the package or with other Tylenol-containing products.
Let your doctor know if your symptoms don't improve in a few days, or if you have a really bad sore throat with a fever, headache, nausea, or vomiting.

basics.benefits_moa: Alka-Seltzer Plus Night Cold and Flu is a combination medicine that treats cold and flu symptoms. Acetaminophen relieves pain and reduces fever. Dextromethorphan is a cough suppressant. Phenylephrine is a decongestant that clears your sinuses. Doxylamine is an antihistamine that relieves a runny nose and makes you very sleepy.
basics.bottom_line: Alka-Seltzer Plus Night Cold and Flu is good for multiple cold symptoms at night, but it's more medicine than you need if you only have one symptom.
downsides: If you don't really need all of the medications in this combination, you're taking extra medicine and might have extra side effects for no reason.
Phenylephrine doesn't last as long as other decongestants like pseudoephedrine.
You shouldn't use it if you have high blood pressure.
To avoid hurting your liver, you have to keep track of the total amount of acetaminophen (APAP) you're taking since it's a very common ingredient in pain and cold/flu combination medicines.

downsides_processed.orig: If you don't really need all of the medications in this combination, you're taking extra medicine and might have extra side effects for no reason.
Phenylephrine doesn't last as long as other decongestants like pseudoephedrine.
You shouldn't use it if you have high blood pressure.
To avoid hurting your liver, you have to keep track of the total amount of acetaminophen (APAP) you're taking since it's a very common ingredient in pain and cold/flu combination medicines.

upsides: Alka-Seltzer Plus Night Cold and Flu is a combination medicine that relieves multiple cold symptoms. It's good to use if you have a stuffy nose, a cough, fever, and pain.

The decongestant (phenylephrine) has fewer side effects than other decongestants like pseudoephedrine. It doesn't raise your blood pressure and heart rate as much, or cause as much trouble falling asleep.
The cough suppressant (dextromethorphan) works well and has very few side effects.
The pain reliever (acetaminophen) is easier on your stomach and has fewer drug interactions than other pain medications like aspirin or ibuprofen.
The antihistamine (doxylamine) can help you sleep.

risks_warnings.title: Liver damage
risks_warnings.description: Alka-Seltzer Plus Night Cold and Flu contains acetaminophen, also known as Tylenol or APAP, and is a common ingredient in many other over-the-counter medicines. Taking too much acetaminophen causes liver damage that can be permanent and life-threatening. In case of an overdose, call your local Poison Control Center and get medical attention immediately.
risk_factors: Drinking more than 2 alcoholic beverages a day

description_processed.orig: Alka-Seltzer Plus Night Cold and Flu contains acetaminophen, also known as Tylenol or APAP, and is a common ingredient in many other over-the-counter medicines. Taking too much acetaminophen causes liver damage that can be permanent and life-threatening. In case of an overdose, call your local Poison Control Center and get medical attention immediately.

risks_warnings.title: High blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: People taking Alka-Seltzer Plus Night Cold and Flu and MAO inhibitors together, or up to 14 days apart from each other, can experience very high blood pressure that can cause headaches and strokes. MAOI drugs are used to treat Parkinson's disease, depression, and other emotional conditions. Talk to your doctor or pharmacist if you're taking MAO inhibitors and still want to use a cough medicine.

description_processed.orig: People taking Alka-Seltzer Plus Night Cold and Flu and MAO inhibitors together, or up to 14 days apart from each other, can experience very high blood pressure that can cause headaches and strokes. MAOI drugs are used to treat Parkinson's disease, depression, and other emotional conditions. Talk to your doctor or pharmacist if you're taking MAO inhibitors and still want to use a cough medicine.

risks_warnings.title: Chronic cough from an infection
risks_warnings.description: Let your doctor know if you have lung problems like chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) or a chronic cough before taking Alka-Seltzer Plus Night Cold and Flu. Make sure to tell your doctor if your cough doesn't go away after a week or comes back after getting better, especially if you're coughing up significantly more mucus (phlegm), which can be a sign of a more serious infection.
risk_factors: History of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD)

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Doxylamine, the antihistamine in Alka-Seltzer Plus Night Cold and Flu, lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful and avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.
risk_factors: Taking with other medicines that make you less alert

risks_warnings.title: Antihistamine side effects
risks_warnings.description: Doxylamine, the antihistamine in Alka-Seltzer Plus Night Cold and Flu, can cause dry mouth, blurred vision, constipation, and trouble urinating. It can also make you feel dizzy, which increases the risk of falls.

risks_warnings.title: High blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: People taking DayQuil Cold and Flu and MAO inhibitors together, or up to 14 days apart from each other, can experience very high blood pressure that can cause headaches and strokes. MAOI drugs are used to treat Parkinson's disease, depression, and other emotional conditions. Talk to your doctor or pharmacist if you're taking MAO inhibitors and still want to use a cough medicine.

risks_warnings.title: Serotonin syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Serotonin syndrome is a rare but potentially life-threatening condition when there's too much serotonin in the brain. The dextromethorphan in DayQuil Cold and Flu, when used with other medicines that affect serotonin (antidepressants, lithium, triptans, St. John's wort), increases your risk for serotonin syndrome. Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Get medical attention right away if you have these symptoms.

basics.benefits_moa: NyQuil Cold and Flu is a combination medicine that treats cold and flu symptoms. Acetaminophen relieves pain and reduces fever. Dextromethorphan is a cough suppressant. Doxylamine is an antihistamine that relieves a runny nose and makes you very sleepy.
basics.bottom_line: NyQuil Cold and Flu is a useful combination medicine that relieves cold and flu symptoms and will help you sleep. Make sure you really need all of its ingredients.
downsides: If you don't really need all of the medications in this combination, you're taking extra medicine and might have extra side effects for no reason.
You shouldn't use it if you have high blood pressure.
To avoid hurting your liver, you have to keep track of the total amount of acetaminophen (APAP) you're taking since it's a very common ingredient in pain and cold/flu combination medicines.

upsides: NyQuil Cold and Flu is a combination medicine that relieves multiple cold symptoms. It's good to use if you have watery eyes, a cough, fever, and pain.

The pain reliever (acetaminophen) is easier on your stomach and has fewer drug interactions than other pain medications like aspirin or ibuprofen.
The antihistamine (doxylamine) will help you sleep.

basics.benefits_moa: Robitussin Daytime Cold Plus Flu is a combination medicine that treats cold and flu symptoms. Acetaminophen relieves pain and reduces fever. Dextromethorphan is a cough suppressant. Phenylephrine is a decongestant that clears your sinuses.
basics.bottom_line: Robitussin Daytime Cold Plus Flu is good for multiple cold and flu symptoms, but it's more medicine than you need if you only have one symptom.
downsides: If you don't really need all of the medications in this combination, you're taking extra medicine and might have extra side effects for no reason.

upsides: Robitussin Daytime Cold Plus Flu is a combination medicine that relieves multiple cold and flu symptoms. It's good to use if you have a stuffy nose, a cough, fever, and pain.

basics.benefits_moa: Tylenol Cold and Flu Severe is a combination medicine that treats cold and flu symptoms. Acetaminophen relieves pain and reduces fever. Dextromethorphan is a cough suppressant. Phenylephrine is a decongestant that clears your sinuses. Guaifenesin is an expectorant that breaks up and thins out mucus.
basics.bottom_line: Tylenol Cold and Flu Severe is an okay combination medicine that relieves cold and flu symptoms, so make sure you really need all of its ingredients.
downsides: If you don't really need all of the medications in this combination, you're taking extra medicine and might have extra side effects for no reason.
Phenylephrine doesn't last as long as other oral decongestants like pseudoephedrine.
You shouldn't use it if you have high blood pressure.
To avoid hurting your liver, you have to keep track of the total amount of acetaminophen (APAP) you're taking since it's a very common ingredient in pain and cold/flu combination medicines.
Two of the medications in this product could potentially work against each other. Guaifenesin makes mucus easier to cough up, while dextromethorphan stops you from coughing.

risks_warnings.title: High blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: People taking Tylenol Cold and Flu Severe and MAO inhibitors together, or up to 14 days apart from each other, can experience very high blood pressure that can cause headaches and strokes. MAOI drugs are used to treat Parkinson's disease, depression, and other emotional conditions. Talk to your doctor or pharmacist if you're taking MAO inhibitors and still want to use a cough medicine.

description_processed.orig: People taking Tylenol Cold and Flu Severe and MAO inhibitors together, or up to 14 days apart from each other, can experience very high blood pressure that can cause headaches and strokes. MAOI drugs are used to treat Parkinson's disease, depression, and other emotional conditions. Talk to your doctor or pharmacist if you're taking MAO inhibitors and still want to use a cough medicine.

risks_warnings.title: Serotonin syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Serotonin syndrome is a rare but potentially life-threatening condition when there's too much serotonin in the brain. The dextromethorphan in Tylenol Cold and Flu Severe, when used with other medicines that affect serotonin (antidepressants, lithium, triptans, St. John's wort), increases your risk for serotonin syndrome. Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Get medical attention right away if you have these symptoms.

risks_warnings.title: Chronic cough
risks_warnings.description: Let your doctor know if you have lung problems like chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) or a chronic cough before taking Tylenol Cold and Flu Severe.
